content: the scrappy crochet rug by 3 moon knits this crochet rug is the perfect stash buster- it is made using 8 strands of worsted weight yarn held together so adding scraps of yarn is easy to do the rug can be made as big or as small as you would like- you could even make mini ones and use them as place mats pattern by sheila of 3 moon knits i love to see your projects using my patterns- let s connect on instagram @3moonknits tag your projects with #thescrappyrug to be featured materials -a lot of worsted yarn i used sugar n cream cotton yarn - 9 mm crochet hook -stitch marker -tapestry needle notes -it is easiest if you place your skeins/balls of yarn in separate bowls so they don t get tangled while you work or try to use center pull yarn -some curling may occur along the edges you can steam block these flat - number in the parentheses at the end of each round is the number of stitches that round has -adding all sorts of colors makes for a very fun and colorful rug there is no wrong color abbreviations beg- beginning chain- chain magic_ring- magic_ring single_crochet- single_crochet pm- place marker round/rnds- round/rounds slip_stitch- slip_stitch st/sts- stitch/stitches pattern round 1 starting with a magic_ring single_crochet 6 sts into the magic_ring slip_stitch into beg st 6 round 2 chain 1 pm 2sc into each stitch until the end of the round slip_stitch into beg st 12 round 3 chain 1 pm *2sc into first st single_crochet into next st* repeat from * to * 6 times slip_stitch into beg st 18 round 4 chain 1 pm *2sc into first st single_crochet into next 2 st* repeat from * to * 6 times slip_stitch into beg st 24 round 5 chain 1 pm *2sc into first st single_crochet into next 3 st* repeat from * to * 6 times slip_stitch into beg st 30 repeat this pattern of increasing by 6 sts every round until you reach your preferred size cut yarn and use tapestry needle to weave in ends steam block if desired copyright 2021 sheila boyer no part of this pattern or photos may be reproduced in any form any products made using this pattern may be sold but must give pattern credit to 3 moon knits if you have any questions about the pattern please feel free to email me at 3moonknits@gmail com
